question: 夕焼け
sourceMnemonic: When the <kanji>evening</kanji> is <kanji>burning</kanji> with sun, it is the sun going down, getting all close to the horizon and earth. This is the <vocabulary>sunset</vocabulary>, or more specifically, the <vocabulary>evening glow</vocabulary> you can see during a sunset.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings are the kun'yomi vocab readings. Combine <ja>夕</ja> and <ja>焼け</ja> (you learned the reading via the kanji) and you'll have <ja><reading>ゆうやけ</reading></ja>.
